tspan.tspan: Nolop Makerspace
Tufts University
The Brother SE1900 machine does both sewing and
embroidery. There are different setups for each
functionality. The two key differences between these two
setups are the presser foots and the accessory unit. If the
machine is set up for the opposite function than you want,
you will have to swap these components (see page __
about switching between).
Sewing Guide
Step 0: Make sure the machine is set up correctly for sewing
Step 1: Turn on the machine
Flip the black switch on the right side of the machine to turn it on.
Step 2: How to thread the upper thread
Raise the presser foot using the presser foot lever at the back
Press (Needle position button) once or twice to raise the needle
Place the thread spool on the spool pin with the wider part of the spool on the right
Slide the spool cap onto the pin as far to the right as possible to secure the spool in place. Be careful to make sure
no thread gets caught between the spool and the spool cap.
Hold the thread lightly with your right hand and use your left hand to pull and guide the thread. Follow the solid
arrows and numbers until you reach number 4.
At number 4, hook the thread into the elbow of the shutter and pass the thread back down towards number 5.
Press to lock all keys and operation buttons
Slide the thread behind the needle bar thread guide at number 6. The thread can easily be slid behind the needle bar
thread guide by holding the thread in your left hand, then feeding the thread with your right hand, as shown. Make
sure that the thread is passed through to the left of the tab of the needle bar thread guide.
Insert the thread through the eye of the needle from front to back. The eye of the needle is at the bottom.
Pass the end of the thread through and under the presser foot, and then pull out about 5 cm (approx. 2 inches) of
thread toward the rear of the machine. * show the channel
Press to unlock all keys and buttons.
Step 3: How to thread the bobbin thread
Open the clear bobbin cover plate by sliding the tab on the right to the right
Place the bobbin spool in the bobbin case (orientation: make the spool rotate counterclockwise when the thread is
pulled) Follow the diagram.
Guide the thread along the path following the arrows
Cut the thread with the metal edge
Replace the clear bobbin cover plate
Step 4: How to fill a bobbin spool
Place the spool of the desired thread color on the spool pin
Slide the spool cap onto the pin to hold spool in place
Place the empty bobbin spool on the bobbin winder shaft.
Slide the bobbin winder in the direction of the arrow (to the right) until it snaps into place
Hold the thread with your right hand and with your left hand, pass the thread allong the dashed arrows and following
the numbers to number 3
Hold the thread with your left hand, wind the thread clockwise around the bobbin 5-6 times with your right hand
Pass the end of the thread through the guide slit in the bobbin winder seat and then pull the thread to the right to cut
it
Slide the sewing speed controller to the right (fast)
Turn on the machine
The green button will be yellow
Press down on the foot pedal to wind the bobbin
When the bobbin is close to full, stop winding
Shift the bobbin winder to the left again and cut the end of the thread
Remove the bobbin
Undo the bobbin winding thread path
Rethread the upper thread
Step 5: Select stitch type: explain basics of straight vs zigzag
Press on the operation panel
For basic straight stitches and zigzag stitches, select folder 1
You can scroll through the stitch options using the arrows on the operation panel
Click on the screen to select the stitch type you want
Stitch types that start with two stitch dashes at the top have a built in reinforcement stitch and stitch types that only
have one first stitch dash doesn’t have a built in reinforcement stitch
Check which presser foot is required for the stitch, indicated in the upper-left corner of the screen, and then attach it.
Step 6: Place fabric underneath the presser foot and lower the presser foot
Set the fabric under the presser foot. Hold the fabric and thread with your left hand, and rotate the handwheel
counterclockwise or press (Needle position button) to set the needle in the sewing start position.
Lower the presser foot
Step 7: Speed selection
Adjust the sewing speed with the sewing speed controller.
You can use this controller to adjust sewing speed during sewing.
Step 8: Sewing
Use your foot to press the pedal and start sewing
Guide the fabric lightly by hand.
A reverse stitch will strengthen the stitch you are trying to sew at the beginning and at the end.
When the machine has sewed 4 or 5 stitches press the reverse button to reinforce the stitches
Then continue sewing forward
At the end of sewing press the reverse button again to secure the end of the thread
Step 9: Raise presser foot and snip threads to remove sewing project
Press (Thread cutter button) to trim the upper and bobbin threads. You can also cut the threads using scissors or the
thread cutter on the side of the machine.
Raise the presser foot
Remove the sewing project
Step 10: Turn off machine
Flip the black switch on the right side of the machine to the O setting to turn it off.
Embroidery Guide
Step 1: Make sure the machine is set up correctly for embroidery
Step 2: Turn on the machine
Step 3: Screen will say “embroidery unit will move” → press okay
Step 4: How to thread the upper thread
Raise the presser foot using the presser foot lever at the back
Press (Needle position button) once or twice to raise the needle
Place the thread spool on the spool pin with the wider part of the spool on the right
Slide the spool cap onto the pin as far to the right as possible to secure the spool in place. Be careful to make sure
no thread gets caught between the spool and the spool cap.
Hold the thread lightly with your right hand and use your left hand to pull and guide the thread. Follow the solid
arrows and numbers until you reach number 4.
At number 4, hook the thread into the elbow of the shutter and pass the thread back down towards number 5.
Press to lock all keys and operation buttons
Slide the thread behind the needle bar thread guide at number 6. The thread can easily be slid behind the needle
bar thread guide by holding the thread in your left hand, then feeding the thread with your right hand, as shown.
Make sure that the thread is passed through to the left of the tab of the needle bar thread guide.
Insert the thread through the eye of the needle from front to back. The eye of the needle is at the bottom.
Pass the end of the thread through and under the presser foot, and then pull out about 5 cm (approx. 2 inches) of
thread toward the rear of the machine. * show the channel
Press to unlock all keys and buttons.
Step 5: How to thread the bobbin thread
Open the clear bobbin cover plate by sliding the tab on the right to the right
Place the bobbin spool in the bobbin case (orientation: make the spool rotate counterclockwise when the thread is
pulled) Follow the diagram.
Guide the thread along the path following the arrows
Cut the thread with the metal edge
Replace the clear bobbin cover plate
Step 6: How to fill a bobbin spool
Place the spool of the desired thread color on the spool pin
Slide the spool cap onto the pin to hold spool in place
Place the empty bobbin spool on the bobbin winder shaft.
Slide the bobbin winder in the direction of the arrow (to the right) until it snaps into place
Hold the thread with your right hand and with your left hand, pass the thread allong the dashed arrows and
following the numbers to number 3
Hold the thread with your left hand, wind the thread clockwise around the bobbin 5-6 times with your right hand
Pass the end of the thread through the guide slit in the bobbin winder seat and then pull the thread to the right to
cut it
Slide the sewing speed controller to the right (fast)
Turn on the machine
The green button will be yellow
Press down on the foot pedal to wind the bobbin
When the bobbin is close to full, stop winding
Shift the bobbin winder to the left again and cut the end of the thread
Remove the bobbin
Undo the bobbin winding thread path
Rethread the upper thread
Switching from Sewing to Embroidery
Replace the sewing presser foot with the embroidery foot
Raise the presser foot lever.
Press the black lever on the back of the presser foot holder to eject the presser foot
Loosen the set screw just enough to remove the presser foot holder
Open the sewing accessory compartment
Store the presser foot in its slot of the top tray
Place the presser foot holder in the lower level
Take the embroidery foot out
Hook the embroidery foot onto the set screw so that the horizontal bar at the top points towards you and tighten the
set screw to secure into place
Attach the embroidery unit
Turn the machine OFF
Remove the sewing accessory compartment from the front base of the machine by sliding it out to the left
Slide the tab on the cover of the connection port in the direction of the arrow to open the cover.
Slide the embroidery unit into place until you hear a click
Turn on the machine again to start embroidering
Switching from Embroidery to Sewing
Replace the sewing presser foot with the embroidery foot
Loosen the set screw and remove the embroidery foot
Open the sewing accessory unit
Place embroidery foot in lower level
Take the presser foot holder out of the lower level
Take the presser foot labeled J out of the top tray
Insert the presser foot holder onto the set screw and tighten into place
Press the black lever on the back of the presser foot holder, insert the metal bar of the presser foot into the front
groove of the holder, and let go of the black lever
Attach the sewing accessory unit
Press to park the embroidery unit
Turn the machine OFF
Hold the release button on the bottom left of the embroidery unit, and slowly pull the embroidery unit to the left.
Slide the tab on the cover of the connection port to close the cover.
Slide the sewing accessory compartment onto the front base by sliding to the right
